*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Emily M. Perry, November 5, 1832. Settlement with Hawkins estate. Cheerful confidence in progress of Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Brazoria */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="11-05-1832">Nov. 5. 1832*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*I believe I have nearly got through the troublesome business of settling my affairs with the *person_mentioned*Hawkins estate*/person_mentioned* and I have in this settlement given up at least one fourth of what I was entitled to, in order to have it finally finished and off my mind.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr Perry*/person_mentioned* is going on very well and will soon have some *location_mentioned*cabbins*/location_mentioned* up, I have a situation joining him so that after a while we will be near together,*location_mentioned* within half a mile*/location_mentioned*, and I hope shall yet enjoy some peace in each others society—it distracts me to see you unhappy—everything has turned out differently from what I expected when I first wrote to *person_mentioned*Perry */person_mentioned*to move, the prospects were then very good and the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned**location_mentioned*in peace, but if you were satisfied I should not be at all discouraged at the present state of things—this country*/location_mentioned* must prosper in the end, it cannot be otherwise-—*date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1832">this year*/date_mentioned* has been bad—unusually wet, and filled with trouble, but *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1833">next year */date_mentioned*will be much better—this world is all trouble, or not so bad, just as we chuse to make it—content is everything.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
